title: 🚨 The Go Map Comparison Trap
content:
**Most beginners think** you can compare two maps with `==`.

But in Go, doing this will **crash your program** instantly! 💥

title: 🛠 What Actually Happens
content:
Go **only allows** map comparison with `nil`.

Why? Because maps are like **locked boxes** — Go doesn't open them up for comparison.

If you try:
```go
if m1 == m2 {
    fmt.Println("Equal")
}
```
➡ **Compile-time error**: `invalid operation: m1 == m2`

title: ⚡ The Right Way
content:
You have 2 safe options:

1️⃣ **Loop & compare** keys/values.
2️⃣ Use `reflect.DeepEqual()` for quick checks.

```go
if reflect.DeepEqual(m1, m2) {
    fmt.Println("Equal")
}
```

title: 💡 Why This Matters
content:
- Avoids program crashes ❌💥
- Keeps your code **predictable** ✅
- Saves you from **debugging nightmares** 😅
